intro: Pectinea, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plumbaginaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Pectinea thrives in coastal areas and well-drained soils, making it a hardy species adapted to saline environments. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
